# Scale: Major in F (Mode: Phrygian)

## Brief Description
The Major scale in F played with a Phrygian mode gives a unique and exotic flavor to the traditional Major tonality. The Phrygian mode is the third mode of the major scale and creates a distinct sound due to its lowered 2nd note compared to the regular Major scale.

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- Gb (Minor 2nd)
- Ab (Minor 3rd)
- Bb (Perfect 4th)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- D (Major 6th)
- Eb (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major scale in F with a Phrygian mode is often used in metal, flamenco, and other genres for creating a dark, exotic, and mysterious atmosphere. The lowered 2nd note in the scale gives it a distinct Middle Eastern or Spanish sound, evoking feelings of tension and drama.

1. "End of the Beginning" by Black Sabbath
2. "Take the Time" by Dream Theater
3. "Spanish Fly" by Van Halen
